intro: Ampelocissus sarcocephala, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by fleshy, red berries. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
